turns.text: It's so clean.  No germs.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: You're afraid of germs?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I have to go.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Why do you think there aren't any germs in the air, James?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: This is April, right?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: July.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: July?!

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Do you know what year it is?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: What year is it?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: What year do you think it is?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: You think it's July of 1995?  That's the future, James.  Do you think you're living in the future?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: No, 1995 is the past.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: 1995 is the future, James.  This is 1989.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: It was some lady.  She didn't know anything.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Perhaps it was a wrong number...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: No.  That's the reason they chose me -- I remember things.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: James, where did you grow up?  Was it around here?  Around Baltimore?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: I have the...strangest feeling I've met you before...a long time ago, perhaps. Were you ever...?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Wait!  This is only 1989!  I'm supposed to be leaving messages in 1995.  It's not the right number yet.  That's the problem.  Damn!  How can I contact them?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: It's just a shot to calm you.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: No more drugs.  Please...

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: I have to do this, James.  You're very confused.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Cole!  James Cole!  You escaped from a locked room six years ago.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: 1989.  Six years for you.  There's the sign!  Right here!

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: I can't believe this is a coincidence, Mr. Cole.  Have you been...following me?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You told me you'd help me.  I know this isn't what you meant, but...I was desperate... no money...bum leg... sleeping on the streets. I probably smell bad.  Sorry about that. But then I saw your book in a store window with a notice about your lecture.  I can read, remember?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Yes, I remember.  Why do you want to go to Philadelphia?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: It's the next step.  I checked out the Baltimore information, it was nothing. It's Philadelphia, that's where they are, the ones who killed everyone.  Zs that a radio?  Does it play music?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You used to call me "James".

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: You'd prefer that? ... James...you don't really have a gun, do you.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Everybody's got a gun.  In this city...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: "Never cry wolf!"

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: My father told me that.  "Never cry wolf."  Then people won't believe you if...something really happens.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: "If something really happens"...like what, James?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Something bad.  Is that all the music? I don't want to hear this stuff...

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Did something terrible happen to you when you were a child?  Something so bad...?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Ohhhh, that one!  Can we hear that one?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You were in my dream just now.  Your hair was different, but I'm sure it was you.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: We dream about what's important in our lives. And I seem to have become pretty important in yours.  What was the dream about?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: About an airport...before everything happened.  It's the same dream I always have -- the only one.  I'm a little kid in it.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: And I was in it?  What did I do?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You were very upset.  You're always very upset in the dream, but I never knew it was you before.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: It wasn't me before, James.  It's become me now because of...what's happening.  Please untie me.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: No, I think it was always you.  It's very strange.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: You're flushed.  And you were moaning. I think you're running a fever.  What are you doing?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: My notes.  Observations.  Clues.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Clues?  What kind of clues?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: A secret army.  The Army of The Twelve Monkeys.  I've told you about them. They spread the virus.  That's why we have to get to Philadelphia.  I have to find them -- it's my assignment.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: What will you do...when you find this...secret army?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I just have to locate the virus in its original form before it mutates.  So scientists can come back and study it and find a cure.  So that those of us who survived can go back to the surface of the earth.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Does that disturb you, James?  Thinking about that little boy in the well?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: When I was a kid I identified with that kid, down there alone in that pipe...a hundred feet down -- doesn't know if they're going to save him.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: What do you mean -- when you were a kid?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Nevermind.  It's not real -- it's a hoax.  A prank.  He's hiding in a barn. Hey, turn left here.  Left!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Look, I'm warning you.  You do anything, I'm going to go crazy -- hurt people!

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: I'm not going to "do" anything, I promise.  But you need help, James. None of this is what you think it is.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: They're keeping an eye on me.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Who's keeping an eye on you?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: The man...with the voice.  I recognized him.  He's from the present.  He...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Are you hurt?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Uh, no.  Yes.  I mean, just some scrapes...

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Oh, Jesus, James!  You killed him!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I did him a favor.  Now come on.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: You didn't have a gun before, did you?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I've got one now.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I told you what I want.  Lock the door!

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: James, why don't we...?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Lock it now!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Mason???

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Jeffrey Mason?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: All I see are dead people.  Everywhere. What's three more?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: You know Dr. Mason's son, Jeffrey Mason, don't you, James?  You met him in the County Hospital six years ago.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: The guy was a total fruitcake.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: And he told you then his father was a famous virologist.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: We need gas.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: I thought you didn't know how to drive.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I said I was too young to drive.  I didn't say I was stupid.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: What's the matter with your leg?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I got shot.  Look -- there's a gas station up ahead.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Shot!  Who shot you?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: It was some kind of...war.  Never mind, you wouldn't believe me.  Turn off here.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You were going to run out off gas on purpose, weren't you?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: No.  I want you to turn yourself in, James -- It'll go much better for you if you do -- but I'm not going to trick you.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: That has your name on it.  Give him cash.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You smell so good.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: You have to give yourself up, you know.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: What have you done?  Did you...kill someone?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: No!  I...don't think so.  I stole a car and they chased me.  I hit a tree.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: See -- you can drive after all!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Yeah, sort of, I guess.  I...I'm sorry I locked you up.  I thought...I thought... I think maybe I am crazy!

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: What made you think that?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Jeffrey Mason said it was my idea about the virus.  And suddenly, I wasn't sure.  We talked when I was in the institution, and it was all...fuzzy. The drugs and stuff.  You think maybe I'm the one who wiped out the human race?  It was my idea?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Nobody is going to wipe out the human race.  Not you or Jeffrey or anybody else.  You've created something in your mind, James -- a substitute reality. In order to avoid something you don't want to face.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I'm..."mentally divergent".  I would love to believe that.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: It can be dealt with, but only if you want to.  I can help you.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I need help all right.  They're coming after me.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: First, it's important that you surrender to them instead of them catching you running.  Okay?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: It would be great if I'm crazy.  If I'm wrong about everything...the world will be okay.  I'll never have to live underground.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Give me the gun.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: The gun! ... I lost it

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: You're sure?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: No gun!  Stars!  Air!  I can live here.  Breathe!

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: James!  That's a policeman.  Pretend you don't know me.  If he sees you...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: No, I want to turn myself in.  Where is he?  Don't worry -- it's all okay now.  I'm not crazy any more!  I mean, I am crazy, mentally divergent, actually, but I know it now and I want you to help me.  I want to get well...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I don't understand what we're doing.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: We're avoiding the police until I can....talk to you.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You mean, treat me?  Cure me?  Kathryn, those words on the wall -- I've seen them before...  I...I...dreamed them.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Okay...you were standing there looking at the moon...you were eating grass... then what?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I thought I was in...prison again.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Just like that?  You were in prison?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: No, not really.  It's...it's in my mind.  Like you said.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: You disappeared!  One minute you were there, the next minute you were gone. Did you run through the woods?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I don't know -- I don't remember.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: The boy in the well.  How did you know that was just a hoax?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: It was?  I didn't...know.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: James, you said he was hiding in the barn...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I think I saw a TV show like that when I was a kid.  Where a boy...

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: IT WASN'T A TV SHOW!  IT WAS REAL!

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: What does this mean to you?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: ...I had a dream about...something like that.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: You had a bullet from World War One in your leg, James!  How did it get there?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You said I had delusions -- that I created a world -- you said you could explain everything...

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Well, I can't. ... I mean...I'm trying to.  I can't believe that everything we do or say has already happened, that we can't change what's going to happen, that I'm one of the three billion people who are going to die...soon.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I want to be here.  In this time.  With you.  I want to become...become a whole person.  I want this to be the present. I want the future to be unknown.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: James...do you remember...six years ago...you had a phone number!  You tried to call and...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You want me to rob him?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: I...I...We need cash, James.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: It's a Carpet Cleaning Company...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: A Carpet Cleaning Company?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: No superiors!  No scientists.  No people from the future.  It's just a Carpet Cleaning Company.  They have voice mail -- you leave a message telling them when you want your carpet cleaned.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You... you left them a message?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: I couldn't resist.  I was so relieved. Wait'll they hear this nutty woman telling them...they better watch out for the Army of the Twelve Monkeys...

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: You... you couldn't have heard me.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: They got your message, Kathryn.  They played it for me.  It was a bad recording...distorted.  I didn't recognize your voice.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I think I've seen this movie before. When I was a kid.  It was on TV.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Shh -- don't talk.  Hold still.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I have seen it, but I don't remember this part.  Funny, it's like what's happening to us, like the past.  The movie never changes -- it can't change -- but everytime you see it, it seems to be different because you're different -- you notice different things.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: If we can't change anything...because it's already happened, then we ought to at least smell the flowers.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Flowers!  What flowers?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Why are we doing this?

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: So we can stick our heads out the window and feel the wind and listen to the music.  So we can appreciate what we have while we have it.  Forgive me, psychiatrists don't cry.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: But maybe I'm wrong.  Maybe you're wrong.  Maybe we're both crazy.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: In a few weeks, it will have started or it won't.  If there are still baseball games and traffic jams, armed robberies and boring TV shows -- we'll be so happy, we'll be glad to turn ourselves in to the police.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: You were in my dream just now.  I didn't recognize you.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Well, you look pretty different, too.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I mean in my dream -- I didn't realize it was you.  Then...I woke up and I...I thought you were gone.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: I remember you...like this.  I feel I've known you before.  I feel I've always known you.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: That's what they were up to!  Freeing animals!

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: On the walls -- they meant the animals when they said, "We did it."

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I know this place! ... This is my dream.

turns.speaker: RAILLY
turns.text: Airports all look the same.  Maybe it's...  James!  Your moustache!  It's slipping.
